reviewText: Disappointed.  Only had Follow the River and not the Long Way Home

I've given this 5 stars only because The Long Way Home is such a wonderful movie.  Out of the Woods is one of the dullest, most boring movies I've ever seen and Follow The River is just O.K.  It's a good buy for the 3 movies and The Long Way Home was worth the price and more.
A testimony to one womans courage and determination,this is an insight into the ever present danger of pioneer settlers on the American frontier.
I and a friend have enjoyed watching this movie twice.  There is nothing more to say, other than it was well worth the purchase.
The movies are ok. I love movies, these are good moral and thought provoking movies and are good for family viewing, could be good quality time spent with your family. CA_MN
Wonderful story lines without all the negativity found in many of today's films.  Good for any age group.

Follow the River / The Long Way Home / Out of the Woods I enjoyed the movie very much. I watched the movie after reading the book, it has a very interesting twist to the ending of the movie. Would recommend both movie and book.
I have been looking for this movie for a while and was pleasantly surprised to find it so easily and at a reasonable price.  thx.

I found that all 3 movies were great - each in their own way.  Out of the Woods - was a heartwarming & light-hearted tale about a son reconnecting with his father.  Follow the River - a beautiful drama set in the pioneering days where a woman must use everything to protect her family & make her way home.  Finally, The Long Way Home - a heartwarming tale of 2 opposite making their way cross country for 2 different reasons.  All I would recommend.!
